entry.et: modification of Anglo-French reconois-, stem of reconoistre, from Latin recognoscere, from re- + cognoscere to know cognition

def.dt: :to admit as being lord or sovereign
:to admit as being of a particular status
:to admit as being one entitled to be heard :give the floor to
:to acknowledge the de facto existence or the independence of
:to acknowledge or take notice of in some definite way: as
:to acknowledge with a show of appreciation recognize an act of bravery with the award of a medal
:to acknowledge acquaintance with recognize a neighbor with a nod
:to perceive to be something or someone previously known recognized the word
